tool_description: The API returns the number of days,  hours, working days, working hours, wages, weekend days, and the list of public holidays of the requested date period and country. You can also add any number of working days or working hours to a given date. 50 countries and over 230 regional calendars are supported and we work hard to keep our database up to date by following government announcements regarding public holidays changes. All the calendars can be fully customized from our friendly working da...
name: Working days
title: Working days

api_list.name: /1.3/get_info_day
api_list.description: Get detailed information about a specific day.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date to analyze (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

api_list.name: /1.3/delete_custom_period
api_list.description: Removing a previously defined custom period

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: The ID of the calendar we are customizing.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD) If omitted, end date will be equal to start date (one day custom period)

api_list.name: /1.3/analyse
api_list.description: Analyse a period (you provide a start_date and an end_date over a given calendar, we respond with the period analysis)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end date's time (24 hours format, like 09:00 or 15:00, but not 3pm).If omitted, default value is 23:59.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The start date's time (24 hours format, like 09:00 or 15:00, but not 3pm).If omitted, default value is 00:00

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

api_list.name: /1.3/add_working_hours
api_list.description: Add an amount of working time to a given start date/time

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The start time in a 24 hours format with leading zeros.

parameters.name: increment_time
parameters.description: The amount of working time to be added (or removed) to the start date time. Format H:i. This amount cannot exceed 5000 hours. For example, to add one hour: 1:00. To add 30 hours and 15 minutes: 30:15.  To remove 45 minutes: -0:45

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

api_list.name: /1.3/list_non_working_days
api_list.description: List the non working days (weekend days, public holidays and custom dates) between two dates in chronlogical order.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

utterances.utterance: List the non-working days between January 1, 2023, and December 31, 2023, in the United States.
What are the non-working days from March 1, 2023, to March 31, 2023, in Canada?
Get the list of non-working days between July 1, 2023, and July 31, 2023, in Germany.
Find the non-working days from October 1, 2023, to October 31, 2023, in France using the 'Public holidays' configuration.
List the non-working days between April 1, 2023, and April 30, 2023, in Japan.
What are the non-working days from May 1, 2023, to May 31, 2023, in Australia?
Get the list of non-working days between September 1, 2023, and September 30, 2023, in the United Kingdom.
Find the non-working days from November 1, 2023, to November 30, 2023, in Italy using the 'National holidays' configuration.
List the non-working days between June 1, 2023, and June 30, 2023, in Brazil.
What are the non-working days from August 1, 2023, to August 31, 2023, in Spain?

api_list.name: /1.3/define_custom_period
api_list.description: Defining a custom period (typically days of vacations of an employee or days of annual closure of a company) can be done from the working days websites user interface but can also be done programmatically from the API. A typical use case would be to retrieve the vacations of the workers out of the human ressources software and insert them into a custom calendar, then being able to query available working days.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A textual description of the custom period (up to 30 caracters)

parameters.name: profile_id
parameters.description: The ID of the calendar we are customizing.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of custom period when displayed on the calendar. Colors can be useful in order to classify custom periods. Default value is orange.

parameters.name: start_morning
parameters.description: Does the custom period starts in the morning of the start_date? Default value is true. (This parameter can be used if you want to create half day custom periods.)

parameters.name: end_afternoon
parameters.description: Does the custom period ends in the afternoon of the end_date? Default value is true. (This parameter can be used if you want to create half day custom periods.)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the custom period (YYYY-MM-DD) If omitted, end date will be equal to start date (one day custom period)

api_list.name: /1.3/add_working_days
api_list.description: Add (or remove) any number of working days to a date.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The ISO country code (2 letters). See available countries & configurations

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

parameters.name: increment
parameters.description: The number of working days you want to add to your start date (positive or negative integer but not zero)

parameters.name: include_start
parameters.description: Should the count include the start_date? Default value is true. If you set include_start to false ("false" or "0"), the count will start at the next working day (or previous working day, if increment is negative)

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: The name of the preset configuration to be used. See available countries & configurations

utterances.utterance: Add 5 working days to the date 2023-10-01 in the United States.
Calculate the date after adding 3 working days to 2023-11-15 in Canada, excluding the start date.
Find the date 7 working days after 2023-12-25 in Germany using the 'Federal holidays' configuration.
Subtract 2 working days from 2023-09-10 in France.
Add 10 working days to 2023-08-20 in the United Kingdom, including the start date.
Determine the date 15 working days after 2023-07-04 in Australia.
Calculate the date 4 working days before 2023-06-30 in Japan.
Add 8 working days to 2023-05-01 in Italy, excluding the start date.
Find the date 12 working days after 2023-04-15 in Spain using a custom profile.
Subtract 6 working days from 2023-03-20 in Brazil.
